Description: A sealing from a document, the imprint of the papyrus remaining at the rear: upper segment of a large intaglio seal with a head of Zeus-Ammon and the upper part of a seated figure of Isis with Harpokrates on her lap; behind the Ammon head is a faint illegible inscription. Adjacent are small oval impressions from intaglio gems, one with a raised longitudinal spine, and parts of two others. Unfired pale yellow-brown mud.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Donated: Egypt Exploration Society. Roman, probably second century AD. The inscription behind the Ammon head is illegible but may be 'AMON'.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3635)
